abstracts.cdata!:
The major objectives of the Second
            Education Project will be: (i) to strengthen the
            Government's capacity for education planning and
            financing, as well as for project implementation and
            evaluation; and (ii) to improve the quality of primary
            education in rural areas. The project will include the
            following components: (a) strengthening the
            Government's capacity to build, repair, and maintain
            school buildings; (b) reconstruction and/or rehabilitation
            and furnishing of about 300 primary school classrooms;
            construction of about 100 houses for primary school
            principals in remote rural areas; and distribution of
            educational materials and textbooks to primary schools in
            three regions of the country, covering approximately 54,000
            students and 800 teachers; and (c) technical assistance,
            specialists' services, and fellowships to strengthen
            education planning, establish a capacity for the evaluation
            of national education programs, and prepare future education projects.
